description.narrative: ANONYMOUS will work to strengthen the work of its educational communications team and improve the equipment to support current environmental campaigns. A model focused on extractives is central to development within the country; however indigenous territorities and sustainable resource management and agriculture are threatened, and legitimate demands are being criminalized. Since 2006, the group has been providing communication services for multiple groups, in particular indigenous groups, but its equipment has become old and obsolete and requires improvements. The group will renovate and optimize the production of a radio program and distribute physical and digital programs. It will work to optimize and purchase other audiovisual materials and equipment, as well as improve its website. Programming will include coverage on the consultation law, agrochemicals, geneticall modified organisms (GMOs), organic gardens, A, and the campaign to protect the Isiboro Secure National Park and Indigenous Territory (TIPNIS), and petroleum.
